department.en: Graduate School, Division of Natural Science

paper_title.en: Convergence of Dirichlet Forms Induced on Boundaries of Transient Networks

description.en: In this paper, the Kuramochi boundary of a connected transient network is studied in connection with the Hilbert space consisting of functions with finite Dirichlet sum, and it is proved that the Dirichlet form induced on the boundary of a connected finite subset of the network Mosco-converges to that on the Kuramochi boundary as the connected finite subset increases to exhaust the network.

paper_title.en: Expansion constants and hyperbolic embeddings of finite graphs

description.en: In this paper, we study a finite connected graph which admits a quasi-monomorphism to hyperbolic spaces and give a geometric bound for the Cheeger constants in terms of the volume, an upper bound of the degree, and the quasi-monomorphism.

paper_title.en: RANDOM WALKS AND KURAMOCHI BOUNDARIES OF INFINITE NETWORKS

description.en: In this paper, we study a connected non-parabolic, or transient, network compactified with the Kuramochi boundary, and show that the random walk converges almost surely to a random variable valued in the harmonic boundary, and a function of finite Dirichlet energy converges along the random walk to a random variable almost surely and in L-2. We also give integral representations of solutions of Poisson equations on the Kuramochi compactification.

paper_title.en: Convergence of metric graphs and energy forms

description.en: In this paper, we begin with clarifying spaces obtained as limits of sequences of finite networks from an analytic point of view, and we discuss convergence of finite networks with respect to the topology of both the Gromov-Hausdorff distance and variational convergence called Gamma-convergence. Relevantly to convergence of finite networks to infinite ones, we investigate the space of harmonic functions of finite Dirichlet sums on infinite networks and their Kuramochi compactifications.

paper_title.en: Convergence of Riemannian manifolds and Laplace operators. I

description.en: We study the spectral convergence of compact Riemannian manifolds in relation with the Gromov-Hausdorff distance and discuss the geodesic distances and the energy forms of the limit spaces.

paper_title.ja: Spectral convergence of Riemannian manifolds, II
paper_title.en: Spectral convergence of Riemannian manifolds, II

description.ja: We prove a precompactness theorem concerning the spectral distance on the set of isometry classes of compact Riemannian manifolds and study the completion of a precompact family.
description.en: We prove a precompactness theorem concerning the spectral distance on the set of isometry classes of compact Riemannian manifolds and study the completion of a precompact family.

paper_title.en: Dirichlet finite harmonic functions and points at infinity of graphs and manifolds

description.en: In this paper, we consider the Royden compactifications relative to P-Dirichlet integrals of infinite graphs and noncompact Riemannian manifolds, and study the behavior of rough isometries in the compactifications, proving bijective correspondence of the spaces of p-harmonic functions with finite p-energy.

paper_title.en: Convergence of Riemannian manifolds and laplace operators, II: Dedicated to Professor Takushiro Ochiai on his sixtieth birthday

description.en: We study spectral convergence of compact Riemannian manifolds or more generally certain Dirichlet spaces, obtaining some compactness results on harmonic functions and harmonic maps. © Springer 2006.

paper_title.en: Variational Convergence of Finite Networks

description.ja: We report some recent results and raise some open questions concerning Gromov-Hausdorff, variational and spectral convergence of finite networks endowed with the resistance metrics and measures, and also Royden's compactification of infinite networks.
description.en: We report some recent results and raise some open questions concerning Gromov-Hausdorff, variational and spectral convergence of finite networks endowed with the resistance metrics and measures, and also Royden's compactification of infinite networks.
